SQLFunctionSpec.Name: USR_UFN_ISBATCHCOMMITTED
SQLFunctionSpec.Description: Determines if a given batch has been committed or not
SQLFunctionSpec.Author: Memphis Sellers
SQLFunctionSpec.CreateFunctionSQL:
-- ============================================= -- Author: Memphis -- Create date: 7/2/2012 -- Description: Returns a bit that says if the Batch has committed or not -- ============================================= CREATE FUNCTION USR_UFN_ISBATCHCOMMITTED ( -- Add the parameters for the function here @BATCH_NUMBER nvarchar(100) ) RETURNS bit AS BEGIN -- Declare the return variable here DECLARE @Result bit DECLARE @BATCHID uniqueidentifier
-- Add the T-SQL statements to compute the return value here SELECT @BATCHID = ID FROM BATCH WHERE BATCHNUMBER = @BATCH_NUMBER AND STATUS = 'Committed'
IF @BATCHID IS NOT NULL BEGIN -- the batchid is also the BUSINESSPROCESSPARAMETERSETID -- the batch is committed so return a 1 SET @Result = 1; END ELSE BEGIN -- the batch isn't finished yet, so return a 0 SET @Result = 0; END ;
-- Return the result of the function RETURN @Result
END
